channel.title: bchumanist TikTok
channel.description: OK Boomer, all the latest TikToks from bchumanist

item.title: Replying to @geigerclick We're funded by about 400 individual small donors. We operate on under $100,000 annually. We also respect uphold our donor's right to privacy.
item.description: Replying to @geigerclick We're funded by about 400 individual small donors. We operate on under $100,000 annually. We also respect uphold our donor's right to privacy.

item.title: #stitch with @CBC Vancouver Canada - and BC in particular - is increasingly diverse and secular. Politicians, especially the ostensibly social democratic premier of the majority non-religious province, should not invoke god in their public speeches. The s

item.title: On January 31, atheist Bob LeDrew asked Cobourg council to proclaim Atheist Awareness Day. While they refused his request, they also rescinded a Christian Heritage Month proclamation. Good work Bob! For our part, we're asking city councils to proclaim Apr
item.description: On January 31, atheist Bob LeDrew asked Cobourg council to proclaim Atheist Awareness Day. While they refused his request, they also rescinded a Christian Heritage Month proclamation. Good work Bob! For our part, we're asking city councils to proclaim Apr

item.title: Replying to @sisterearthangel Let's get every municipality that's proclaimed Christian Heritage Month to recognize April 15 as Religious Neutrality Day.
item.description: Replying to @sisterearthangel Let's get every municipality that's proclaimed Christian Heritage Month to recognize April 15 as Religious Neutrality Day.

item.title: Did you know Humanist weddings are illegal in British Columbia? Help us change the law.
item.description: Did you know Humanist weddings are illegal in British Columbia? Help us change the law.

item.title: Replying to @geigerclick Civil marriages must include two specific lines that are not required of religious marriages in BC. The sample ceremony can be modified but is still prescribed by the government for marriage commissioners.
item.description: Replying to @geigerclick Civil marriages must include two specific lines that are not required of religious marriages in BC. The sample ceremony can be modified but is still prescribed by the government for marriage commissioners.

item.title: Happy International Women's Day. We need to continue to resist fascism, Christian Nationalism and tech doomerism that all seek to re-establish the patriarchy and roll back our hard-won rights. #IWD2025 #internationalwomensday
item.description: Happy International Women's Day. We need to continue to resist fascism, Christian Nationalism and tech doomerism that all seek to re-establish the patriarchy and roll back our hard-won rights. #IWD2025 #internationalwomensday

item.title: The BC Court of Appeal upheld the privacy rights of the #exreligious #exjw We intervened in the case and were very pleased with the outcome. But it's also likely not the last battle in this ongoing litigation. Help us continue to represent the voice of t

item.title: Replying to @egm1991 The JWs could be looking at $100k fines for breaching the Personal Information Protection Act.

item.title: Vancouver Mayor Ken Sim has proclaimed April 15 as Religious Neutrality Day in the city!

item.title: Did you read our latest report Prayer Free BC? It's available free on our website.

item.title: Replying to @dfreeze666 Chilliwack North MLA Heather Maahs invited ARPA. The others in attendance were reportedly Kristina Loewen of Kelowna Centre, Harman Bhangu of Langley-Abbotsford, Korky Neufeld of Abbotsford West, Anna Kindy of North Island and Lynn

item.title: Replying to @wlfngeeksclthng The more voices we get adding these ideas to the budget consultation, the more we build momentum to get these ideas into policy.

item.title: Kelowna Rally for Tax Fairness July 22, 2025 at 3:30 PM outside Kelowna City Hall Join us and the Kelowna Atheists, Skeptics and Humanists Association to call on council to revisit the hundreds of thousands of dollars of money granted to religious groups
item.description: Kelowna Rally for Tax Fairness July 22, 2025 at 3:30 PM outside Kelowna City Hall Join us and the Kelowna Atheists, Skeptics and Humanists Association to call on council to revisit the hundreds of thousands of dollars of money granted to religious groups

item.title: Kelowna is subsidizing global missionary work. We're supporting KASHA's call for fair property tax exemptions in Kelowna and will be at their rally on Tuesday, July 22, 2025 at 3:30 PM at City Hall. Hope to see you there!
item.description: Kelowna is subsidizing global missionary work. We're supporting KASHA's call for fair property tax exemptions in Kelowna and will be at their rally on Tuesday, July 22, 2025 at 3:30 PM at City Hall. Hope to see you there!

item.title: We had an incredible time rallying outside Kelowna City Hall today for fair property tax exemptions. It's time to end the presumption that religion is a net positive.
item.description: We had an incredible time rallying outside Kelowna City Hall today for fair property tax exemptions. It's time to end the presumption that religion is a net positive.

item.title: It's time Kelowna paused its tax exemptions for places of worship and make sure that funds support local causes.Highlight from our July 22, 2025 Kelowna Fair Tax rally.
item.description: It's time Kelowna paused its tax exemptions for places of worship and make sure that funds support local causes.Highlight from our July 22, 2025 Kelowna Fair Tax rally.

item.title: Moosomin Elementary School in Saskatchewan still opens with the Lord's Prayer because of a special carve out in that provides education act. And we're back from our impromptu summer hiatus. Make to follow us for more progressive, secular and anti-Christia
item.description: Moosomin Elementary School in Saskatchewan still opens with the Lord's Prayer because of a special carve out in that provides education act. And we're back from our impromptu summer hiatus. Make to follow us for more progressive, secular and anti-Christia

item.title: Replying to @403farmkid The only reason we still fund Catholic schools is because our politicians are cowards. Newfoundland and Quebec abolish religious separate school funding in the 1990s. The remaining provinces could do it tomorrow.
item.description: Replying to @403farmkid The only reason we still fund Catholic schools is because our politicians are cowards. Newfoundland and Quebec abolish religious separate school funding in the 1990s. The remaining provinces could do it tomorrow.

item.title: Our latest report looked for unconstitutional prayers in PEI municiplaities and... we only found one! Read the full report on our website. #secularism #prayertok #PEI
item.description: Our latest report looked for unconstitutional prayers in PEI municiplaities and... we only found one! Read the full report on our website. #secularism #prayertok #PEI

item.title: We're going to the Supreme Court of Canada to argue the duty of religious neutrality is core to the Charter of Rights and can't be trammeled by the notwithstanding clause.
item.description: We're going to the Supreme Court of Canada to argue the duty of religious neutrality is core to the Charter of Rights and can't be trammeled by the notwithstanding clause.

item.title: It's permissive tax exemption season. Recently, Saanich Councillor @tealepb spoke about the need for public benefits tests before municipalities grant these exemption requests to places of worship.#PermissiveTaxExemptions #TaxTheChurch
item.description: It's permissive tax exemption season. Recently, Saanich Councillor @tealepb spoke about the need for public benefits tests before municipalities grant these exemption requests to places of worship.#PermissiveTaxExemptions #TaxTheChurch

item.title: #stitch with @Church of Gnome Unfortunately, you won't see any pointy hat ministers in Canada anytime soon because our governments are steeped in Christian privilege, preferring the rights of traditional churches to those of individual believers.
item.description: #stitch with @Church of Gnome Unfortunately, you won't see any pointy hat ministers in Canada anytime soon because our governments are steeped in Christian privilege, preferring the rights of traditional churches to those of individual believers.

item.title: #stitch with @BC Humanist Association Fraser Health clarified that they have no contract with Hope for Women crisis pregnancy centre but we're still left wondering how this happened in the first place.
item.description: #stitch with @BC Humanist Association Fraser Health clarified that they have no contract with Hope for Women crisis pregnancy centre but we're still left wondering how this happened in the first place.

item.title: On Saturday, we were proud to stand alongside hundreds in Vancouver protesting the direction of the US administration. This clip is from Global News on Otber 18, 2026 (find the full segment on their website).
